contentrichtext.text: {{MedalTableTop}} {{MedalSport | Men's [[ski jumping]]}} {{MedalOlympic}} {{MedalGold | [[1972 Winter Olympics|1972 Sapporo]] | [[Ski jumping at the 1972 Winter Olympics|Individual normal hill]]}} {{MedalWorldChampionships}} {{MedalSilver| [[1970 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships|1970 Vysoké Tatry]] | Individual normal hill}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Yukio Kasaya''' (笠谷 幸生 ''Kasaya Yukio'', born August 17, 1943 in [[Yoichi, Hokkaido]]) is a former Japanese [[ski jumping|ski jumper]]. He was one of the most successful ski jumpers of the late 1960s and the early 1970s. At the [[1970 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships]] at [[Vysoké Tatry (town)|Vysoké Tatry]], [[Czechoslovakia]], he finished second in the individual normal hill behind [[Gariy Napalkov]] ([[Soviet Union]]). At the 1971/72 [[Four Hills Tournament]], he won the first three jumping events and would probably have won the overall combined tournament. However, before jumping in the last event at [[Bischofshofen]], he returned to [[Japan]] in order to prepare for the [[1972 Winter Olympics]], which took place in [[Sapporo]]. There he won the gold medal in the individual normal hill, where Japan won all three medals. In 1972 the Olympic Games also doubled as the [[FIS Nordic World Ski Championships]], so Kasaya's gold medal victory in the individual normal hill made him world champion as well. As Japan's first ever Winter Olympic gold medalist, Kasaya is a national hero. ==External links== *{{FIS|S=JP|ID=29544|name=Y.
